# Satya Nadella says AI must boost human productivity, not replace jobs

By [Ashish Singh](https://www.digit.in/author/ashish-singh/) \|
Updated on 30-Dec-2025




HIGHLIGHTS

## Nadella wants AI to act as a “bicycle for the mind,” enhancing human capabilities instead of automating people out of work.

## He says the AI industry has moved past experimentation and must now deliver real-world, measurable value.

## The Microsoft chief also warned that responsible AI use is crucial due to its heavy demand on energy, computing power and talent.

![Satya Nadella says AI must boost human productivity, not replace jobs](https://static.digit.in/Microsoft-CEO-Satya-Nadella-3.png)

[![Ashish Singh](https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/fb08e9dbed9efb48c3539a8ea17fc855?s=70&d=mm&r=g)](https://www.digit.in/author/ashish-singh/)[Ashish Singh](https://www.digit.in/author/ashish-singh/)

30-Dec-2025

Artificial intelligence has become a hot topic for discussion in 2025, and this year, it is expected to continue. We have seen big tech companies introducing new large language models, image generation models and much more. While many believe that the new models may impact jobs, big tech leaders believe the AI boom will continue, but in a meaningful way. Recently, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said that the focus in 2026 must move beyond hype and automation, towards using AI as a tool that meaningfully enhances human capability.
